<<<<<<< HEAD
An account of the Blessed Trinity argued from the nature and perfection of the Supream Spirit, coincident with the Scripture doctrine, in all the articles of the Catholick Creeds; together with its 1 mystical 2 fœderal 3 practical uses in the Christian religion, by William Burrough rector of Chynes in Bucks. Burrough, William, b. 1639 or 40.
[8], 64 p.
printed for Richard Baldwin at the Oxford Arms in Warwick-lane, near the Oxford-Arms-Inn, London : 1694.
The words "1 mystical .. practical" are bracketed together on the title page. Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
=======

Burrough, William, b. 1639 or 40.
[8], 64 p.
printed for Richard Baldwin at the Oxford Arms in Warwick-lane, near the Oxford-Arms-Inn, London : 1694.
The words "1 mystical .. practical" are bracketed together on the title page. Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
